title: The Ordination of the Priests
summary: Exodus 29 outlines the ceremony to consecrate Aaron and his sons as priests. It includes sacrifices, the anointing, and the offering of food. God promises to dwell among His people and sanctify the tabernacle.

faq.question: How were the priests ordained?
faq.answer: Through washing, dressing in sacred garments, anointing, and offering sacrifices over seven days.

faq.question: What promise did God make at the end of the chapter?
faq.answer: That He would dwell among the Israelites and be their God.
